storyInfo: Vina received a mysterious gift when the Exemplars broke into the city, confirming for the first time that an old friend had survived.

attributes.text: I couldn't decide how to start the chapter on Allerdale, when I decided to write one for her. I realized I knew so little about the name that should've been so familiar to me.
\nThe last Cumberland. The one who betrayed us. The one who gave her life to save us. The one who bragged about her cream stew.
Millscar. Caster's minion. Cumberland the Ever on High. Which one was the real Allerdale?

attributes.content: <p=1>Londinium Underground Tunnel</><p=2>September 28th, 1098, 4:53 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Thirty-four minutes until the Exemplars break through the blockade
Coordinates confirmed, boss. The location in the anonymous warning message is just ahead. And we've identified the source—
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: No surprises there. Let's go.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: The mercenary does not move. There is uncertainty on his face.
Out with it.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: The boys trust you. Without you, we would have rotted in the alleys, or the devils would have—
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: I've already died once, so I'm fine with putting my head on the line for you. But this just doesn't make sense. Why should we trust Rhodes Island? We know nothing about them.
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: The Exemplars are almost inside the city. It's going to be bedlam outside. We could take this opportunity to line our pockets...
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: Or at least... you should not risk yourself, being here.
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: You're not the only one who thinks this way, are you?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: The mercenary is silent. He dares not meet Millscar's gaze, fearing her wrath.
But nothing happens.
Have you thought about what will become of Londinium after this war?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Er... the way it used to be?
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: No, nothing will go back to the way it used to be. No one can go back, no matter what comes of this war.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Y-You're abandoning us?
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: No, I need you. Soon, Londinium will become a city in need of mending.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: The old order has been destroyed by death and violence. There will be plenty of gaps left behind, plenty to feed us.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: I'm not asking your opinion.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Listen, I don't plan on going back to the old life, which means we have to plan for a new one. I haven't forgotten about you, of course.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: In order to keep our livelihood, we need people to know what we're capable of.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Don't say I didn't give you a choice. So, are you coming or not?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Oh, sod it, put me at the front of the line, boss.
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: I'm not imagining it, am I... what is this...?
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: The blood-red rocks in the gaps of the frame and in the furnace... did the devils hide them here? What are they planning?
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: Vampire stuff.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: There is a faint smell of blood in the air. She recalls the onrushing squirming monsters that came straight out of a nightmare.
Boss! I found something here!
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: A ducal alliance soldier?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Something's not right. He hasn't been dead for long. The name tag... Fifth Infantry Regiment, Eighth Column. Rank... Major?!
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: The Earl of March's troops, under the Duke of Normandy. No external wounds, but the death was not natural.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Her unit should still be outside the walls. Why would a major from the unit be here—
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Where did they come from? Kill them, and quickly. The orders must not be delayed.
There are other altars that still need to be activated. There is no time.
The devils have us surrounded! There's no way out—
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: Why do we need one?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: 'Lunatic'.
No one knows where the Steam Knight sword in her hand came from, much less where Millscar herself came from.
The mercenary's legs tremble. He regrets not turning around a few minutes ago.
As long as that purple blade would not impale him from behind.
Bugger all.
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: Huh. I know that sword.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: The General's briefing mentioned you. You've got nerve. Is the tin can somewhere nearby?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Maybe we can kill two fowlbeasts with one stone.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Carry on with your work, I'll handle this—
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: *jingle*
Like wind chimes on the beams of a mausoleuma caressed by a breeze, the golden pendants and gems that hang from the veil of the one who slumbers sway and clang against each other in the air.
Excuse me, did anyone see my earring?
There you are, Little Garnet—Oh, it's broken...
I guess I'll have to borrow your toys, Duq'arael. Not like you're in any position to refuse.
The blood-red altar within the iron frame begins to glow, but quickly goes dark again and then shatters.
The broken red pendant in the air is now good as new, glowing with a faint light.
The red glow is almost mesmerizing.
*jingle*
The sound echoes by Millscar's ear.
Take care of Little Garnet for me, for a while.
She'll lead you where you belong. Now, you should go.
I'm surprised that anyone like Dame Kal'tsit would trust you, though.
She sees the red and black figure.
Why would a vampire save my life? Dame Kal'tsit? Dr. Kal'tsit of Rhodes Island? What are they planning?
She has many questions, but finds herself holding the cold conical earring in her hand.
There's no time to waste if you want to help that one. This is not the only altar in these parts.
attributes.name: Mysterious Vampire

attributes.content: What do I do?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: She will tell you.
attributes.name: Mysterious Vampire

attributes.content: 'She'? Millscar suddenly feels a pulse from the earring in her hand, like a heartbeat.
Stop her—
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Shh.
attributes.name: Mysterious Vampire

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive*!
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Nadine feels all the blood in her body rush back towards her heart for a second, and the vertigo that comes with it.
For the first time, she envies the kindred who have abandoned flesh and blood.
The path has been prepared.
attributes.name: Mysterious Vampire

attributes.content: Take care of her, and she will guide you to me.
attributes.name: Mysterious Vampire

attributes.content: <p=2>September 28th, 1098, 5:21 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Six minutes until the Exemplars break through the blockade
Let's go to the next one.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Boss, that weird Vampire thing... as we destroy the altars, it just keeps getting... prettier.
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: We've got more important things to worry about. Word is that the Exemplars have made it into the city, but they're being impeded by the ducal alliance's troops.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Have the factories gotten the order?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Aye. They're getting ready.
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: These strange hidden Sarkaz altars, and rumors that the dukes are ready to leave Londinium blockaded and abandon it to its fate...
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Hah. Who's the one who actually wants to blow up the city?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Does it really matter?
It's been a while, Allerdale.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I thought you were dead.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: I thought YOU were dead.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Even with Rhodes Island's help, there are too many of these for you to deal with, and too little time.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Who knows how many such altars the Sarkaz have hidden across the city? Without my knowledge, too. They could not have done it on their own.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: More than one key district will be reduced to rubble if these altars are activated. I've discovered and destroyed several key ones, however.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: By yourself...?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Vina needs help. The Exemplars need one final push. And the dukes need to hear the true voice of the people.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: It was I who spread the rumors that the dukes are planning to abandon Londinium. Not that there wasn't an element of truth to it.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: What do you want me to do?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: You're already doing it. You and those who follow you.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: But you, too, need a little push. I'll take care of the remaining altars.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: You've changed. A lot.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: I could say the same for you, 'Millscar'. Are you sure you like that name?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: You've chosen to live. Then follow the path, and see where it leads.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Boss, she's—
attributes.name: Concerned Mercenary

attributes.content: Run like you've got all Kazdel on your heels. Go to the outer city, and tell the others to get ready to receive the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: <p=1>Londinium</><p=2>September 28th, 1098, 5:27 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: The Exemplars break through the blockade. Across the city, factories roar to life, welcoming them home.

attributes.text: I keep thinking back to that afternoon.
\nFactories, Vina, steam, cheering, boxing, angry yelling, Baird...
\nThe bits of memory gush to the surface together, mixing together, wiping away what happened that afternoon.
The one thing I will never forget is when Vina said: 'We're home.'
\nI wanted to cry. It was a long, long journey, from the day we left the city to the day we came back.
\nWe're home. But how many did we lose, how many who walked with us on this journey?
And which of them could come back after they left, besides Allerdale?

attributes.content: <p=1>Exemplars Camp</><p=2>September 30th, 1098, 5:22 A.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Two days after the Exemplars break through the blockade
I never knew taking inventory could be such a pain.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Taking inventory at the factories on our turf back in the day wasn't half as bad...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: If this is pain, I'll gladly take more pain.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It sure is exciting, though, to see so many people supporting us—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: (Yawn) We've been at this all night. The sun's already coming up.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We have to push forward. The others can only buy so much time.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Word from Wiš'adel is that they threw a dozen wrenches into the Military Commission's system of command, but the Nachzehrers are still guarding Westhaleg.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We've been inside the city for two days, but there has been little sign of movement from them.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Weren't there rumors that Theresis has abandoned them and gone into hiding? Maybe that's why the Nachzehrers aren't moving.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: That's just speculation. Not even the Doctor's team has been able to confirm it.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Get some rest, Morgan. The alliance's order to attack will come soon—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I just don't like counting, that's all!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I want to help Dagda. I reckon I've got a little more experience sweet-talking people into helping us.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Delphine is persuading the nobles who are still on the fence. Hannah and Catherine are organizing the surviving workers and Self-Salvation Corps. I have no doubt they can get it done.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But Dagda... she's not really the temperament for this...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Go help her.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Phew.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Let's continue. Supplies from Heidi... improvised weapons by the Self-Salvation Corps...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: What's this at the bottom? It's not on the list.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: She looks around and sees only Exemplars transporting supplies. She recognizes all their faces.
She carefully examines the box. After being satisfied that there is no threat, she opens it.
She is struck dumb by what she sees.
It is a set of clothing.
The cool rays of the morning sun shines upon an emblem—
The emblem of House Victoria. Her house.
Vina feels a bout of anger. Is this some kind of sick joke?
Wait, no—
She recognizes the outfit in her hands. It belonged to the Victorian royal family.
Why is it here? Who found it and delivered it to her?
She can only come to one conclusion, a single name.
Let's go. It's time.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: What's the situation, boss?
attributes.name: Alert Mercenary

attributes.content: Their equipment is inferior to the alliance's. The dukes are having the Exemplars take the brunt of the fighting. Casualties will be heavy...
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: But this is also an opportunity.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: The dukes want a hero. The people need a hero. Why not add a finishing touch to the story?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: You're betting on them to win.
attributes.name: Alert Mercenary

attributes.content: Bet? No, the bets were already made when the battle outside the walls ended. This is just the last chance to double down.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: No idea how that works, but whatever you say. What's next?
attributes.name: Alert Mercenary

attributes.content: We kill.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: There will be chaos once the final battle begins, and 'opportunists' too. I'm not about to let them do whatever they want right under my nose.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Say... boss, what was that thing you left behind?
attributes.name: Alert Mercenary

attributes.content: A little stage prop, to give more substance to the legend.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: 'Garment of the royal house, retrieved from the ruins of Cumberland Manor. The leader of the Exemplars can make good use of it.'
'Don't you like the story? The last heir to the throne returns to drive out the devils, garbed in the King's regalia...'
'I heard that she didn't like the title...'
'She'll need it, if she wants to sway those who are still uncertain.'
'For now, at least.'
Is she alive—
Vina has had a little wish, ever since the day that the Steam Knight returned. Perhaps those around her had the same, but no one spoke of it.
She looks around nervously, but does not see her.
If anything, that is a relief. She is not ready.
A note?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: 'Tailored to your size. Hope it fits.'
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: There is no name on the note.
But for the first time, she knows that Allerdale is still alive.
There's something else...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: A few photos, with the following words scribbled on the back.
'Something you might find interesting. Concerning a certain duke.'
